alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 03 at 4:32PM MST until October 03 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 830 PM MST. * At 432 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Lake Pleasant with runoff collection in Agua Fria River and New River. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 inch in 30 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 74 between mile markers 19 and 26. This includes the following streams and drainages... Morgan City Wash, Deadman Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Agua Fria River, New River and Beardsley Canal. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 30 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
